results.title: In America
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell's Kitchen and Fox Searchlight
results.brief_description: From the director of “My Left Foot” and “In the name of the Father” comes a moving portrait of an Irish immigrant family trying to establish a new life in the US after a devastating tragedy. The father (Paddy Considine) is a struggling actor who ends up driving a taxi at night to make a living while the mother (Samantha Morton) raises their two adorable girls (played by real life sisters Sarah and Emma Bolger) while working at a nearby ice-cream parlour. The eldest of the two girls uses her home video camera as a way to document their current life and deal with the past - much of the strength and delight of the film comes from the roles of the children. Set in New York City in a dilapidated apartment building they share with drug dealers, pimps and other poor families, the girls be-friend a neighbour Mateo (Djimon Hounsou) who provides the family with a new outlook and helps them face their grief, while he deals with his own mortality. The loosely autobiographical script is based on Jim Sheridan’s life and was co-written with his two daughters Naomi and Kirsten Sherdian. Nominated for three Academy Awards in 2003.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell’s Kitchen and Fox Searchlight

results.title: Walking on Water
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.description: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.

results.title: Koyaanisqatsi [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Godfrey Reggio and I R E
results.brief_description: Ko-Yaa-Nis-Katsi (from the Hopi language) is a panoramic roller coaster of life that makes you scream but hang on. A spellbinding, staggering non-narrative film that soars across the United States in search of vistas both natural and man-made. Much of the photography is in slow motion and time-lapse edited in such away as to produce an entirely different perspective to everyday reality. With cinematography by Ron Fricke and mesmerising music by Philip Glass, the film juxtaposes distortion with truth producing quite often alarming results. It is divided into five segments as follows: 1. Crazy life. 2. Life in turmoil. 3. Life out of balance. 4. Life disintegrating. 5. A state of life that calls for another way of living. Also available on VHS [307953]

results.title: The Wiggles movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Dean Covell, Hilton Fatt, Gladusaurus Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Wiggles - Murray, Jeff, Anthony and Greg are planning a surprise birthday party for their friend Dorothy the Dinosaur. There is a big problem however, their guest of honor has gone missing, she’s in pursuit of a magician who has stolen Greg’s wand, and is upset to think her friends have forgotten her birthday. The Wiggles begin a pursuit of their own when they try to locate Dorothy in time for her party, having a wiggling good time along the way. This is The Wiggles first feature length film and includes seven new songs. Cast also includes Tony Harvey, Leeanne Ashley, Carolyn Ferrie, Paul Paddick, John Field and Joanne Samuel. Also available on VHS [310707]

results.title: The Rage in Placid Lake
results.creator_credit: Tony McNamara, Marian MacGowan, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Showtime, Rapacious Pictures and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: A boy called “Placid Lake” is becoming a man. Tormented all through school for being different and for being the product of his new age parents, Placid (Ben Lee) has a reason for being angry. He decides to exact a type of revenge on his parents by having a career in insurance. Helped through life by his academically brilliant and crayon-chewing friend Gemma (Rose Byrne), will Placid survive the bland 9-to-5 of corporate life? Written and directed by Tony McNamara, adapted from his play “The Cafe Latte Kid”. Features music by Ben Lee and Cezary Skubiszewski. Cast includes Garry McDonald, Miranda Richardson.

results.title: Napoleon (1994) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Michael Bourchier, Film Australia, Herald Ace and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: This live action Australian adventure follows an adorable pup on a cross-country search for the dingoes who comprise his doggy roots. Though the cocky young puppy’s real name is Muffin, he prefers to think of himself as Napoleon, a conquering warrior. Napoleon gets more than he bargained for when he is carried aloft in a makeshift air balloon into unknown territory. Embarking on a journey that will turn any pup into a warrior, he dares to go where no pup has gone before; discovering unknown lands and meeting some real friends along the way. [VHS 309191]

results.title: The Stepford wives (1975) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bryan Forbes, Edgar J. Scherick, Fadsin Cinema Associates and Palomar Pictures International
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Ira Levin, the chilling and controversial story of “The Stepford wives” has become a cult classic with its cutting social commentary and chauvinistic/mysognystic themes. It is a tale of perfection, where perfect housewives dutifully serve their husbands and family in domestic bliss in their perfect homes in the sanitised but perfect suburb of Stepford. But something is horribly wrong. Why do all the Stepford men belong to the mysterious Stepford Men’s Club and why do all the women appear to look and behave in the same manner - vacant and robotic? Is there a strange conspiracy going on in the village of Stepford? This very 70s film features Katharine Ross, Paula Prentiss, Peter Masterson, Nanette Newman and Patick O’Neal with screenplay by William Goldman.

results.title: Undead
results.creator_credit: Peter Spierig, Michael Spierig, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Spierigfilm
results.brief_description: Australian twin filmmaking brothers, Michael and Peter Spierig, have written, produced and directed this, their first feature film. They have achieved their goal of creating a schlock splatter horror with a load of laughs but with a sci-fi alien plot twist that makes it stands out. What also stands out is the finish of the film as its low budget is not that evident in the final outcome. Fictional small Australian country town of Berkeley, renowned for its good fishing, is invaded by aliens that send strange meteors from space turning people into the undead - zombies. The local beauty contest winner Rene (Felicity Mason) is about to leave town but is prevented when her driver becomes victim to zombie attack. The local town loony, a tall silent bloke called Marion (Mungo McKay), comes to her aid with a three-barrelled custom-made rifle. Blood, gore, splatter and laughs aplenty ensue as our hapless heroes (including the swearing town cop and his rookie constable, Wayne and his pregnant girlfriend) go about surviving the onslaught of brain sucking zombies. The aliens appear on earth cleansing some folks with healing rain and they are then ascended to orbit the earth. The ending has the potential for a sequel and hopefully someone will give them the money! This is must see cult classic for those into the schlock/horror or low budget independent genre/s. Crew that deserve special mention are the make-up designer Steven Boyle, cinematographer Andrew Strahorn, composer Cliff Bradley and everyone that worked on the special effects, which includes the directors. (“The Making Of” in the extras is worth a look if you’re thinking of making a low budget feature!) Hopefully there will be more from The Spierig Brothers in the future. SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Mystic river
results.creator_credit: Clint Eastwood, Judie G. Hoyt, Robert Lorenz and Malpaso Company
results.brief_description: An intense drama from director Clint Eastwood, about three childhood friends whose paths meet in adult life when one of their teenage children is murdered. Sean Penn (Jimmy) plays the anguished father of the murdered girl (winning an Academy Award for Best Actor for his performance), with Kevin Bacon (Sean) as the police detective investigating, and Tim Robbins as the troubled suspect Dave (also an Academy Award winning performance). Based on the novel by Dennis Lehane. Cast also includes Marcia Gay Harden, Laurence Fishburne and Laura Linney.

results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Roberto Sneider, Lindsay Flickinger, Nancy Hardin, Lizz Speed, Joy Polstein, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Ventanarosa Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Taymor, Roberto Sneider, Lindsay Flickinger, Nancy Hardin, Lizz Speed, Joy Polstein, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Ventanarosa Productions and Miramax Films
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
